newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-LIVERPOOL TO BUILD SOCCER ACADEMY.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-LIVERPOOL TO BUILD SOCCER ACADEMY.

text.p: Liverpool announced Britain's first club-dedicated soccer academy on Thursday.
Chief executive and vice-chairman Peter Robinson said: "We believe that it will be vital in the future that the club be able to produce as many of its own players as possible.
"Although our record is an excellent one the soccer academy will enable us to compete with anyone in the world."

Work on the complex is due to start next year with the doors expected to open at the beginning of the 1998-99 season. There will be as many as 10 pitches, while residential accommodation will be built for the players, who could be as young as eight.
Liverpool already have three home-grown players in the current England squad -- Dominic Matteo, Robbie Fowler and Steve McManaman.
